direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods retrieve specific properties from an object, but getArg retrieves validation arguments while getIndexedProperty retrieves indexed properties.
Both methods retrieve specific elements (Arg and Var) based on a key, suggesting similar test cases can be applied.
Both methods retrieve specific messages or arguments based on a key, indicating similar handling of key-based retrievals.
The validate method depends on the getArg method to retrieve validation arguments, suggesting that test cases for validate should include scenarios for getArg.
Both methods handle the addition and retrieval of arguments, suggesting similar control flows and exception handling.
Both methods deal with retrieving arguments, but getArgs retrieves multiple arguments for a specific key, while getArg retrieves a single argument.
Both methods access properties of an object, but getIndexedPropertySize retrieves the size of indexed properties, while getArg retrieves specific validation arguments.
The generateKey method generates a key that might be used in the getArg method, suggesting that test cases for getArg should consider scenarios where keys are generated.
